vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
πέρᾱν,
Ionic dialect and Epic dialect πέρην, adverb on the other side, across, in early Poets always with genitive, especially of water, νήσων αἳ ναίουσι π. ἁλός [Refs 8th c.BC+]; π. Χάεος ζοφεροῖο[Refs 5th c.BC+]; π. τοῦ Ἑλλησπόντου, τοῦ ποταμοῦ, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; π. Ἕβρον is corrupt in [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__2 absolutely, on the other side, especially of water, προσορμίζεσθαι.. π. ἐν τῇ Ῥηναίῃ [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__3 with Verbs of motion, followed by εἰς, over or across to.., π. ἐς τὴν Ἀχαιίην διέπεμψαν [Refs 5th c.BC+]; also without εἰς, ἐκ Θάσου διαβαλόντες π. having crossed over (i.e. ἐς τὴν ἤπειρον), [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__4 frequently with Article, διαβιβάζεσθαι εἰς τὸ π. τοῦ ποταμοῦ [Refs 5th c.BC+]; διέβη εἰς τὸ π. [Refs]; ἐν τῷ π. [Refs]; τὰ π. things done on the opposite side, [Refs]; τὰ π. πράγματα, opposed to τὰ ἐπὶ τάδε, [Refs 2nd c.BC+]; οἱ π. those on the other side, [Refs 1st c.AD+]; ἡ ὄχθη ἡ π. [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__II over against, opposite, with genitive, π. ἱερῆς Εὐβοίης [Refs 8th c.BC+]
__III less frequently ={πέρα} (A), beyond, with genitive, π. Νείλοιο παγᾶν [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__IV right through, καῦσις [ἔστω] μὴ πέρην [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ἐς τὸ π. [Refs]—π. with genitive usually precedes its case, but follows it in A.[same place], [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: on the other side; (n.) opposite side, region across
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
on the other side; (n.) opposite side, region across
can function as an improper preposition, across, beyond, over, on the other side, Mt. 4:15, 25; 19:1; Jn. 6:1, 17; ὁ, ἡ, τό, πέραν, farther, on the farther side, and τὸ πέραν, the farther side, the other side, Mt. 8:18, 28; 14:22
vocabInfos._es_Definition: prep. con gen. más allá, al otro lado, hacia o en el otro lado ; el otro lado
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: bên kia; ở bên kia; bờ bên kia; ở phía bên kia.
